thread.title: Canadian Dollar Falls After Dovish Central Bank Statement

author: Daniel Kruger
title: Canadian Dollar Falls After Dovish Central Bank Statement
text:
The Canadian dollar fell against its U.S. counterpart after the Bank of Canada said it remains concerned about trade conflicts.
The Canadian dollar snapped a two-day winning streak Wednesday, falling 0.6% to C$1.2628 per U.S. dollar. The WSJ Dollar Index, which measures the U.S. currency against 16 others, advanced for a second consecutive day, rising less than 0.1% to 83.66.
